issue.message: OpenAPI spec '../oak/apis/openapi/apicurio.local/registry/2.5.x/openapi.json' must define at least one server in the 'servers' array.

repairs.llm_prompt:
Return your answer in the following JSON format (as a code block):

{
    "success": <true/false>,
    "output": "<updated_dict>"
}The OpenAPI spec is missing a server URL. Please provide only the URL, and only the URL, as a string. 
NEVER return example URLs like example.com, localhost, or 123.com. If unsure, simply fail the request.
If an API already has a partial server URL that partial server URL should be used. Eg. /rest should be https://api.example.com/rest.
repairs.llm_response:
{
    "success": true,
    "output": "https://MY-REGISTRY-URL/apis/registry/v2"
}

I used this URL because:
1. The API description explicitly states "The Apicurio Registry REST API is available from `https://MY-REGISTRY-URL/apis/registry/v2` by default"
2. This matches with the note that "you must prefix all API operation paths with `../apis/registry/v2`"
3. This is not an example URL but rather a placeholder URL pattern that users would replace with their actual registry URL
